title: Fivestar4everMVP
author: Fivestar4everMVP
content: Hi...Check out this Announcement thread in the gambling section of this forum..https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5399371.0I found out that the op hid his referral link in the infographics, a simple click on the long infographics and checking the link on the bar proves this.Is this process of sharing referral link allowed on this forum? Cus I could remember this is the same thing I did one time that got me temp banned for one week.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: It's not unless op is the owner of the site or the post has been agreed with/come from them afaik (this is just how I've seen the policy be enforced in the past).Sometimes links look like referral links but are used to determine where traffic is coming from by a site owner (which is what this could actually be).

comments.author: TheBeardedBaby
comments.body: The only allowed reference links are in the signature if  I remember correctly. The rest could be reported.As jackg said its possible to be a just a source of the click reference.Just report it and let the moda decide whether it's breaking the rules or not.

comments.author: PX-Z

The link has "refer" word to it and It redirect to a sign up page, so its a referral link obviously It should be reported under no referral code (ref link) spam, regardless who posted it it's against the rules, unless mods tolerate such thing.

comments.author: edgycorner
comments.body: Check the bottom of OP Code:Note: I'm not affiliated with the project directly, nor I'm team member. I have been hired by Jumbo Ticket to post this ANN thread only.He was hired by the owner to make that post, I don't see any problem here.The owner even replies to this ANN thread regularly.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Referral link is only allowed inSignature spaceUse profile pageIf a user put a referral link in a post, it is not allowed and will cause to account ban.However, I see a point that a company need to have a tracking link to assess data and cost-benefit of their campaign. I am not sure but if that OP adds the link per request of the company for this purpose, it is acceptable or not.

comments.author: Mahdirakib
comments.body: The OP (Little Mouse) is hired by the owner of the site to promote their platform. He is working as a middleman here. And it is common thing to see affiliate link under the infographics in a gambling site announcement thread. The owner of the site has said this in that topicQuote from: Jumbo Ticket on May 22, 2022, 10:03:48 AMThe first screenshot you shared is of our official website. The second screenshot is of the promotional $50 bonus welcome offer exclusive for bitcointalk members.Registering with the offer link gives to $50 credits using which you can purchase tickets and participate in our Jackpots. Hope this clarifies your doubt.It means, the owner of the site has created the exclusive referral link for the bitcointalk forum members. You will receive some free balance if you create an account through the referral link of the announcement thread.Probably it isn't forbidden to use referral link under the infographics/hyperlink in the announcement thread if the OP is owner or hired by the owner of the site. 1miau has made an explanation about thisQuote from: 1miau on August 05, 2019, 12:19:24 AMThere are some exceptions, where reflinks could be tolerated like if you are including it in a very informative reply / description which adds value, a site owner who wants to track traffic coming from Bitcointalk or similar where it's very clear that it's no ref-spam. However, spamming with referral link is against the forum rules. But you will find referral link under the infographics in most of the announcement thread in gambling section. Here are some popular and reputable crypto casino with referral link in the announcement threadBitcasino.ioDuelbits.comFreeBitco.inSportsbet.ioStake.com
